name: Centrella Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At first I was unsure about staying here because I was always wary of Bed & Breakfast inns. When we arrived we were kindly greeted by the front desk clerk, who was very kind and courteous. The atmosphere was classic antique chic which I love.Our room was so cute, we got the lovers loft and it had a romantic skylight above our bed. Breakfast was delicious, we chose a belgium waffle which was to die for,I almost wished I had another .We had a great stay.
reviews.title: Comfortable place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on a trip down the coast of Oregon and Northern California. The Inn is refreshingly non-commercial and charming. Our room was comfortable and everything was very clean. The afternoon wine and crackers and breakfast in the morning were lovely and the food was excellent. The staff were very welcoming and went out of their way to make us comfortable. We were close to shops, restaurants and the Aquarium, which we visited after purchasing our tickets at the Inn(didn't have to stand in line either). Overall our experience here was the best of our trip and we wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Centrella Inn if you want a relaxing and comfortable place to stay.
reviews.title: Lovely place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent the President's Weekend at The Centrella Inn,, a 100 year Victorian B&B that is a National Historic Landmark. There are lovely quaint rooms, each with its own bath, in the inn and several cottages around the grounds. The stay includes an afternoon wine and hors d'oeuvres hour and a full breakfast. We stayed in the front room which is handicap accessible (as I was on crutches) and large,bright and sunny. The Inn is about 1 mile from the Aquarium and they have a 2 day pass for the price of one day so we were able to see everything and not get exhausted. Nearby is Vivolo's Chowder House where we had the best meal, better and less expensive than anything on Cannery Row. One block away on Lighthouse Ave. is A Niche In Tyme, wholesale and estate jewelry with great prices and an equally quaint brother and sister ownership. All said, a wonderful weekend.
reviews.title: Right near the Monterey Aquarium

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A late-19th-century Victorian with three floors, many rooms, and several cottages situated around the large,attractive, and relaxing patio and garden. Location is convenient to the water and to downtown Pacific Grove, with easy driving to Monterey or Carmel. Our room was more than adequate. The shower, as others have mentioned, is a high-placed addition to an antique claw--foot tub. Not the most convenient, but it gets the job done (although a safety bar or two might not be a bad idea). Electric heater was efficient and easily controlled, and the windows opened for ventilation. The parlor area features comfortable chairs and sofa with newspapers and other reading matter. The TV is small and on only when someone wants to watch it. (As noted by others, the inn is not a spiffy, 21st-century luxury hotel; it is more on the lines of a B&B or guest hotel you would find in the British Isles.) Breakfast was more than adequate, fresh and well prepared. A menu offered choice of one entree from two quiches; a spinach, cheese, and mushroom omelette with a small portion of home-fries; oatmeal; OR yogurt-fruit parfait. Also available were orange juice, hard-boiled eggs, granola and another cereal, toast, bagels, cream cheese, butter, and English muffins. Coffee (not bad) and tea available all day. In short, plenty of good quality fare. Wireless worked fine. Staff were readily available, helpful, and amicable. If you think you'd enjoy a bit of a step into the past with the benefits of modern conveniences in a beautiful little town by Monterey Bay, this could be your place.
reviews.title: Comfortable, convenient, historic, and inviting

reviews.text: Loved this place! Stayed here two nights on our trip up the coast. It's an easy walk to the monterey bay aquarium and about a block from the beach. The rooms aren't anything fancy since they are pretty dated but the hotel had tons of character. The staff was super friendly, and I even got the recipe to their scones by mentioning I loved them. The breakfast was pretty good, order from their daily menu and then there was a selection of cereals, breads, scones, and hard-boiled eggs. They have a glass of free wine and hors' d'oeuvres in the evening, they also put fresh baked cookies out a little later. Though the rooms are pretty small and dated, also no tv, the hotel has tons of character and the staff was awesome, it was exactly what we were looking for, I definetly plan to come back!
reviews.title: Quaint bed and breakfast in monterey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a lovely B & B inside and out. Decor was true to the period and nicely done. Staff are friendly, grounds are beautiful, our room (one of the less expensive ones) was spacious and comfortable. Having said that, I did have a few problems: We stayed in one of the front rooms (top floor) and there was significant traffic noise, which luckily died down overnight. But there also was a light problem -- street lights shined in through the blinds on our windows and interior hallway lights were surprisingly bright and seeped in as well. I am a light sleeper and had significant trouble staying asleep because our room was so light. I also would recommend against a room on the ground floor as our floor creaked. Finally, although breakfast was good (mainly a choice of several crustless quiches), it wasn't special like in some B & Bs I've stayed at over the years. Nothing I would call gourmet. And I was surprised that there was no fruit other than the single orange slice placed on our breakfast plates. Despite all this, I would stay here again, but maybe not in a front room.
reviews.title: Charming

reviews.text: I loved staying here......not only were the accommodations clean, comfortable, and attractive; but the staff was wonderful! The wine and appetizer time from 5:00-6:00 enabled people to get together and meet while tasting a wonderful wine from Sonoma. The location of the inn is perfect......park your car and walk to whatever attraction Monterey has to offer. I will definitely return!
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Centrella for one night while in Pacific Grove. The Inn is beautiful. We each had a complimentary glass of wine and some snacks in the garden area upon arrival which was welcome after a couple hours in the car. Our room was very nice and comfortable. Breakfast was a choice of main breakfast and then scones, muffins and other goodies. Cookies were found later in the day for a nice treat. Not too far of a walk to the beach. Would stay again when in the area.
reviews.title: Very nice stay a Centrella Inn.

reviews.text: Back again ( last time was 30 march 2010), this time a bigger room with a bath.......
reviews.title: Back again and brought friends

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Has not changed one bit, rooms good, location good, value good........ Would come back again !
reviews.title: Old School Bed and Breakfast

reviews.text: As everyone has noted, the location is superb. A block down from Lighthouse, which is the main street in this charming town of Pacific Grove, and just a few blocks to Lover's Point on the beach. I took a walk along the beach for a few miles at sunrise - very convenient and oh so beautiful! Also, just a 20 min walk to the Aquarium and Cannery Row. The rooms need updating - most are a bit small (remember, Victorian), but if you are active and don't spend much time inside then it's fine. Stayed once in one of the separate cottages - very roomy with a fireplace and small TV separate from the bedroom. Can't say enough about the staff. Honey, Sabrina and Sarah are above and beyond anyone I've ever encountered at other B&B's. They will try and accommodate any needs or requests you have - another major reason to stay here! One not so great perk: The wine/hors d'oeuvres hour needs to be improved - pita chips and dip really are not hors d'oeuvres! If you're looking for something reasonable and clean to lay your head, then would definitely recommend!
reviews.title: Victorian charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved the hotel. It was quiet,great Victorian decor, homey and cozy atmosphere,lovely breakfast. 2 things I wasn't 100% happy with were:the room door wasn't locking properly and it took ages to get a hot water from both-tap and the bath.Also, I was slightly puzzled about the hotel front door which we were able to open with our room key when we returned after 10pm...Does it mean that all rooms had the same key? Oh, another thing, we checked in at 5pm and left the room around 7pm meaning my husband and I had a little rest after a long drive and sight seeing. when we came back at around 10pm, our bed was tidy again. It was OK but unusual for a not 5* hotel
reviews.title: Quiet,cozy and great decor

reviews.text: Just stayed at the Centrella Inn last weekend. You can't go wrong with the location. Close to the ocean, restaurants, and shopping. However, the Inn is in desperate need of an interior updating. We stayed in a Cottage. Too much furniture, some of which were down right uncomfortable. The dresser drawer in the bedroom was unusable. If you are going to charge good money, I just don't want to pay for the location. Breakfast was just ok. Evening wine drinking and nibbles, just ok. Could make this place one of the premier locations in Pacific Grove with some TLC.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location
Lots of character!
reviews.text: We stayed in early September and were glad that we chose Pacific Grove and Centrella. We loved the quaintness of the place (as others have said, if you like shiny, new chain hotels, this won't be for you). I think we were lucky with our room - decent size with claw foot bath and lovely comfy bed. What was great though were the little touches. Freshly baked cookies in reception together with coffee and tea round the clock and my personal favourite, a chilled glass tank of iced water with mint, strawberries, cucumber etc in it. Very refreshing. The wine hour was incredible! The first glass was very generous as were the cheese, biscuits and crudites. We had a second glass of wine and happily paid $5 each for another very generous glass! They made a mistake and charged me for the room even though I had pre-booked via last minute.com. However, this was immediately rectified. Loved the walk down the sea front watching the seals, sea lions and pelicans. Wouldn't have wanted to be down by Cannery Row. Nice and chilled in PG. Recommended.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Centrella Inn is simply charming. It is not what you want if you are looking for a chain hotel, but perfect for those looking for a unique place to stay. It is quiet, friendly and right near fabulous dining and the beach (three minute walk each way).
reviews.title: Charming Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I’m not quite sure why, but I really liked this place. It’s not the cleanest hotel I’ve ever stayed at (cup roulette in the morning to find a properly clean one) but it was welcoming and comfortable with a great location right in the heart of Pacific Grove (with free off-street parking right outside).
reviews.title: Great atmosphere

reviews.text: Stayed in 1 of the cottages which had a lot of space. Bathroom had a claw foot bath with shower over which I thought wouldn’t be great but was one of the best showers during the 2 week trip. Bed was comfy and the room was quiet. The cottage had a separate seating area with TV which is great if you’re sharing and 1 person likes to get up earlier/stay up later.
reviews.title: DISAPPOINTED

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was tea and coffee available all the time, together with cookies. And a wine-and-cheese hour in the early evening with a chance to chat to other guests. For breakfast there was always plenty of bagels, muffins etc available along with juice plus a hot entree. The entree varied hugely – the quiche was so rubbery it felt like it would bounce if I dropped it but the scrambled eggs were good and the waffles also good. Service was really friendly.
reviews.title: Very dated lodging in Pacific Grove

reviews.text: Hadn’t booked ahead and so looked at a few places before deciding to stay here – it had the most welcoming atmosphere and a really nice feel.
reviews.title: An enjoyable stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I have been staying here for the last four years because it was very convenient to everything we wanted to do. It's not a beautiful new hotel and I never expected it to be but it was comfortable. In the past the breakfast and social hour were very, very good and they were always very generous, but something happened this last time. All of a sudden the wine was behind the front desk as though we were going to over drink or something and when I wanted a second glass, they wanted to charge me for it. So the next evening we brought our own, which was much better wine anyway. Really? Then my friend wanted to order a yogurt and a quich, but they told her she could only order one entre. Are you serious? We only ate their breakfast one day and stayed four nights. I was so embarassed. We ended up cancelling the last night and moved to a spa resort for the same price but with more amenities and better serivce.
reviews.title: Antiquated, tiny rooms, way overpriced

description: Capture the Romance of Yesteryear at The Centrella Inn, awarded “The Best Lodging in Pacific Grove, Monterey Peninsula”. We have been the destination of choice for charm and romance since 1889. Enjoy our complimentary signature breakfast, freshly baked pastries daily and evening social hour, featuring hors d'oeuvres and cookies. Ideally located: stroll to Lover’s Point, beach, world-famous Monterey Bay Aquarium and historic Cannery Row. Close to Pebble Beach, Carmel and Big Sur.
